ygData.subject: Re: Maximals Attack
ygData.msgSnippet: OOC: Both I d say. They can survive without either endlessly (they just can t do anything). Logic and memory is in the head actual spark (or whatever

OOC:

Both I'd say. They can "survive" without either endlessly (they just can't
do anything). Logic and memory is in the head actual "spark" (or whatever
passes for it in BW) is in the body.


----- Original Message -----
From: "catmastero" <catmastero@...>
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, May 13, 2002 5:22 AM
Subject: Re: Maximals Attack


> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Jonathan" <jhogan@r...> wrote:
> > > OOC: Do you nead the head or the body to revive someone?
> > >
> >
> > OOC:
> > BW was a little fuzzy on this, sometimes you knock the head off the
> whole
> > bot shut down. Other times the head would still be functioning (in
> one case
> > waspinators body got trash compacted and another TOTALLY dis-
> assembled) and
> > be able to direct parts of the body to do whatever (ie waspinators
> head
> > crawling around by being attached to the wrist of a hand)
> >
> > Basically even without a head Inferno/warhead aren't going to die,
> dunno
> > where you guys got this silly notion stasis lock = death for bots.
> Remember
> > on the show Black arachnia went into extreme stasis lock and shut
> > down....they tossed her in the CR chamber and she woke up (it was
> the big
> > romeo/juliet speech episode done by silverbolt). However again the
> degree of
> > damage a bot can take before they die varied. WAspinator could be
> utterly
> > torn apart yet drag himself around to a CR chamber...dinobot gets
> beat on
> > for a day and literally dies.
> OOC:
> I think Dinobot died because of the cybervenom, first from
> Taranchulus then from Quickstrike. But what part do you need to bring
> to the CR chambor to heal them?
>
>
